TopicTitle: Damned Robotics erors removed all my flights

Articles.Content:
After adding Damned Robotics to my KSP, it gave me all sorts of ship errors when I started the game.

I figured I had not loaded it properly, so I removed the DR* folders from parts folder, and ran KSP again. It now says I have no flights in progress. No big deal, but I lost my 8 flights I had in orbit.

I wish I had a way to reset them though.

Any help would be great.
Backup save files from time-to-time, I always do that. Especially when adding new mods.

I was pretty ticked when I posted. Now I know what to expect.

This morning I'll try a load and see if I can get them back.

Is there a way to load an old save besides using the main menu? Has anyone else had the same issue with this mod?

Shame it looked nice.

Edited June 17, 2013 by Gary_P

It has to be an incompatibility with this current version because when I added the damn robot parts back in, I lost the use of all my parts.

I was using version Damned Robotics Version 1.3 and version 0.20.2.186 of KSP.

Just a warning to others...

Edited June 17, 2013 by Gary_P

You might be able to recover from a quicksave, even if you haven't used that feature. Check the quicksave.sfs file in your saved game's folder. If one is there with a date-modified from before you lost your ships, then it might have them.

As far as Damned Robotics is concerned, I believe the official version is not compatible with .20+ However a patched version can be found somewhere in the thread for that mod.

Thank you. The owner of the mod should post that. I would have.

It's a really neat idea. I was thinking of continuing his work if he was no longer on the project.

Thank you. The owner of the mod should post that. I would have.
